result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Glenn Jenkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with  5 days credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Glenn Jenkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (54 pages) commencing 02-02-2016 received and filed.  CH

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

-  Court sets Restitution at $2,420.91 as to Fat Daddy's
-  Court sets Restitution at $2,076  as to Lululemon

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  7  years, consecutive to any other sentence, with  5 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  2 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  5 years.

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  7  years, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 1; with  5 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  2 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  5 years.

Court finds defendant  IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and  IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Supervision by the Mental Health unit
-  Comply with any recommended mental health treatment
-  Take all prescribed medication
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Random screens
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  No Contact Order with Richard D.   AND/OR  Joshua W.,   AND/OR   Joseph Z.,   AND/OR  Lululemon (business),   AND/OR  Chernin Law Offices,   AND/OR  Convenience Plus,   AND/OR  Fat Daddy's,   AND/OR  Vanguard (business)
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $2,420.91  to Fat Daddy's
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $2,076  to Lululemon
-  Restitution to be paid first; during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisified.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
received and filed.

As to Count  1 and Count 2:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Marcus Glenn Jenkins in court with Attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Marcus Glenn Jenkins in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Arraignment held as to Amended Information filed November 19, 2015.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Count 1:  Burglary (Building Or Dwelling), Repeater - a Class F felony, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 943.10(1m)(a), 939.50(3)(f), 939.62(1)(c)
Count 2:  Burglary (Building Or Dwelling), Repeater - a Class F felony, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 943.10(1m)(a), 939.50(3)(f), 939.62(1)(c)

Matter before the Court on Doctor's Report Return.  Report authored by Michael Woody, Psy.D. opines the defendant competent to proceed.  There being no challenge to the report dated 6-01-14 by the state, defense counsel or defendant, the court found the defendant competent to proceed and ordered the proceedings reinstated; bail amount and conditions same as previously ordered.

Conference held with ADA Jesica Ballenger and Attorney Valeria Taylor.  The Court grants defense request for increase of doctor fees.  The Court approves up to 6 hours with a maximum cap of $750.00.   The Court to consider an additional increase at a later date if necessary.

Defendant Marcus Glenn Jenkins in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Defendant Marcus Glenn Jenkins in custody.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case heard as to return on doctor report.  Defendant disagrees with the report and is requesting a second opion.  Court granted the request as to the second opion with the following conditions:  Defense is to provide an order with the proposed doctor named;  No more than $125.00 per hour with a maximum of 5 hours.  Defense to provide the order no later that 04-22-14 in the afternoon.

Defendants request for new counsel is heard and denied at this time.

Case is adjourned for return on doctor report in Branch 21.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 05-06-2014 at 01:30 pm.

dated 3-31-14 authored by Dr. Brooke E. Lundbohm, received and filed.
dated 3-18-14 from Deborah L. Collins, Psy.D., received and filed.

Defendant Marcus Glenn Jenkins in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Marcus Glenn Jenkins in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Marcus Glenn Jenkins in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Marcus Glenn Jenkins in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
